intro: Panicum swartzianum, commonly known as silver panicum, is a flowering plant species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and fluffy, silver-gray inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its seeds are small and dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to spread across diverse environments. The plant is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and resilience.
